name: Pineapple Guava
climate: Pineapple guavas thrive in subtropical climates with mild winters.
They are best suited to regions with warm, temperate conditions.
This plant prefers environments where frosts are rare and mild.
The ideal climate features moderate humidity and good air circulation.
sunlight: Pineapple guavas need full sun to produce the best fruit yield.
They can tolerate partial shade but with reduced fruiting efficiency.
Optimal growth occurs in sunny locations with direct sunlight exposure.
Ensure the plant receives at least 6 to 8 hours of sunlight daily.
watering: Regular watering is critical, especially during the growing season.
They prefer consistently moist soil but should not be waterlogged.
Reduce watering in the winter months to prevent root rot.
A deep watering system encourages strong root development over time.
soil: Pineapple guavas thrive in well-draining soil to prevent waterlogging.
They prefer slightly acidic to neutral soil pH for optimal growth.
Loamy soil, rich in organic matter, supports healthy plant growth.
Good soil aeration is vital for root health and nutrient uptake.
